verses.verse: My son<WH1121>, attend<WH7181> unto my wisdom<WH2451>, and bow<WH5186> your ear<WH241> to my understanding<WH8394>:
That you may regard<WH8104> discretion<WH4209>, and that your lips<WH8193> may keep<WH5341> knowledge<WH1847>.
For the lips<WH8193> of a strange woman<WH2114> drop<WH5197> as a honeycomb<WH5317>, and her mouth<WH2441> is smoother<WH2509> than oil<WH8081>:
But her end<WH319> is bitter<WH4751> as wormwood<WH3939>, sharp<WH2299> as a twoedged<WH6310> sword<WH2719>.
Her feet<WH7272> go down<WH3381> to death<WH4194>; her steps<WH6806> take hold<WH8551> on hell<WH7585>.
Lest you should ponder<WH6424> the path<WH734> of life<WH2416>, her ways<WH4570> are moveable<WH5128>, that you can not know them<WH3045>.
Hear<WH8085> me now therefore<WH1121>, O you sons, and depart<WH5493> not from the words<WH561> of my mouth<WH6310>.
Remove<WH7368> your way<WH1870> far<WH7368> from her<WH7126>, and come not near the door<WH6607> of her house<WH1004>:
Lest you give<WH5414> your honor<WH1935> unto others<WH312>, and your years<WH8141> unto the cruel<WH394>:
Lest strangers<WH2114> be filled<WH7646> with your wealth<WH3581>; and your labors<WH6089> be in the house<WH1004> of a stranger<WH5237>;
And you mourn<WH5098> at the last<WH319>, when your flesh<WH1320> and your body<WH7607> are consumed<WH3615>,
And say<WH559>, How have I hated<WH8130> instruction<WH4148>, and my heart<WH3820> despised<WH5006> reproof<WH8433>;
And have not obeyed<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of my teachers<WH3384>, nor inclined<WH5186> my ear<WH241> to them that instructed me<WH3925>!
I was almost<WH4592> in all evil<WH7451> in the middle<WH8432> of the congregation<WH6951> and assembly<WH5712>.
Drink<WH8354> waters<WH4325> out of your own cistern<WH953>, and running waters<WH5140> out of<WH8432> your own well<WH875>.
Dont let your fountains<WH4599> be dispersed<WH6327> abroad<WH2351>, and rivers<WH6388> of waters<WH4325> in the streets<WH7339>.
Let them be only your own<WH2114>, and not the strangers' with you.
Let your fountain<WH4726> be blessed<WH1288>: and rejoice<WH8055> with the wife<WH802> of your youth<WH5271>.

Let her be as the loving<WH158> doe<WH365> and pleasant<WH2580> roe<WH3280>; let her breasts<WH1717> satisfy<WH7301> you at all times<WH6256>; and be you ravished<WH7686> always<WH8548> with her love<WH160>.
And why will you<WH1121>, my son, be ravished<WH7686> with a strange woman<WH2114>, and embrace<WH2263> the bosom<WH2436> of a stranger<WH5237>?
For the ways<WH1870> of man<WH376> are before<WH5227> the eyes<WH5869> of the Lord<WH3068>, and he ponders<WH6424> all his goings<WH4570>.
His own iniquities<WH5771> shall take<WH3920> the wicked<WH7563> himself<WH8551>, and he shall be held with the cords<WH2256> of his sins<WH2403>.
He shall die<WH4191> without instruction<WH4148>; and in the greatness<WH7230> of his wickedness<WH200> he shall go astray<WH7686>.
